required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of COVID-19 Vaccination in Patients With Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: The Fifth Medical Center of Chinese PLA General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has caused pandemic since outbreak in 2020. Patients with cancers may be at higher risk than those without cancer for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). At present, limited data are available on the safety and immunogenicity of COVID-19 vaccination for patients with cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, single-arm, open-label clinical trial. A total of 300 patients with different cancers including hepatocellular carcinoma, breast cancer, lung cancer, esophageal cancer, gastric cancer and colorectal cancer were included in this vaccination study. All of the patients will further accept 12 months follow-up study after vaccination. Safety and immunogenicity will be carefully recorded and detected.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 months after the first dose of coronavirus vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Occurence of adverse effects after COVID-19 vaccination

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 months after the first dose of coronavirus vaccine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 13 months after the first dose of coronavirus vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Occurence of adverse effects after COVID-19 vaccination

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 13 months after the first dose of coronavirus vaccine

arm_group.description: Patients in the experimental need to accept the coronavirus vaccination

intervention.description: Coronavirus vaccine was inoculated on day 0 and day 25±3, respectively

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age above 18 years
2. Patients with diagnosed cancers including hepatocellular carcinoma, breast cancer, lung cancer, esophageal cancer, gastric cancer and colorectal cancer were included .
3. Patients who have received local or systemic anti-cancer therapies previously, and have a stable condition with the ECOG score below 2.
4. The functions of multi-organs were normal or basically normal, and there are no contraindications for vaccination.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with acute attack of chronic diseases.
2. Patients have history of convulsion, epilepsy, encephalopathy and psychosis.
3. Patients who are allergic to any component of the vaccine, or have a serious history of vaccine allergy.
4. Pregnant or lactating women.
5. Sufferring serious cardiovascular diseases, such as arrhythmia, conduction block, myocardial infarction, and severe hypertension can not be well controlled by drugs.
6. Patients have severe chronic diseases or diseases can not be controlled well during the progress, such as asthma, diabetes, thyroid disease, etc. Congenital or acquired angioedema / neuroedema.
7. Patients who are receiving immunomodulators treatment such as IL-2 or thymosin.
8. During vaccination, immunosuppressants, systemic cytotoxic drugs, immune checkpoint inhibitors (PD-1 / PDL-1 / CTLA-4, etc.) and cell therapy, including NK cells, cytokine induced killer cells, Dendritic cells、CTL and stem cells infusion are required.

facility.name: The Fifth Medical Center of PLA General Hospital
